forumNotes.author: asecasp
forumNotes.content:
I have created a CD booteable with HWInfo (http: // www.hwinfo.com/) and on having executed it me the following error appears and could not have met on the problem. ``` Not enough memory to run. Please free 15008 bytes of system memory. ```
The configuration of autoexec.bat is ``` @ECHO OFF MSCDEX.EXE /D:CDDRIVER /L:X XMSDSK.EXE 102400 R: /t /y CTMOUSE.EXE PATH=A:\;R:\ GOTO %CONFIG% :HWINFO COPY X:\HWINFO\*.* R: R:\HWInfo.exe x:\ GOTO DOS :DOS ECHO X: CD DRIVE ECHO R: RAM DRIVE ```
And the configuration of config.sys is ``` [MENU] menuitem=HWINFO, HWInfo [DOS] DEVICE=OAKCDROM.SYS /D:CDDRIVER /L:X [HWINFO] include=DOS [COMMON] LASTDRIVE=Z ```

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
A small advice (following the attempt to reduce language barriers :wink:).  

In English a program may generate an ERROR, while an user may be committing a MISTAKE.  

Back to your question, you need to study a bit about the LH or LOADHIGH DOS command:  
[http://www.computerhope.com/lhhlp.htm](http://www.computerhope.com/lhhlp.htm "External link")  

:wink:  

jaclaz

forumNotes.author: asecasp
forumNotes.content: jaclaz already probe with the command LH and I me do not work either, the same error goes out for me.

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> jaclaz already probe with the command LH and I me do not work either, the same error goes out for me.

Let' do a deal.  

You post the info, in a proper way, and I will try and help you.  

HOW did you create the bootable CD? \<-DETAILS  
WHAT bootmanager (if any) are you using? \<-DETAILS  
Does the WHATEVER you put together boots allright to plain DOS if you REM out the commands in :HWINFO section of autoexec.bat?  
If yes, add to the build mem.exe and run it.  
[http://www.computerhope.com/memhlp.htm](http://www.computerhope.com/memhlp.htm "External link")  
Report results.  
Try again after having Loaded HIGH whatever can be loaded HIGH.  
Report results.  
Is memory available the same?  
Try unremming the commands in :HWINFO section.  
Is the erros still:  
> Not enough memory to run.  
> Please free **15008**bytes of system memory.
? ![:lol:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/laugh.png)  

Is this thread related to the other one you just posted?:  
[http://www.boot-land...?...ic=8305\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8305&hl= "External link")  

Have you already considered using grub4dos (or grub4dos/memdisk) floppy image mapping?  
See here:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=3963](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=3963 "External link")  

jaclaz
